content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 9 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 0.9. f of x is 6.80. Column 2. x is 0.99. f of x is 6.86. Column 3. x is 0.999. f of x is 6.90. Column 4. x is 0.9999. f of x is 6.95. Column 5. x is 1. f of x is 2. Column 6. x is 1.0001. f of x is 7.05. Column 7. x is 1.001. f of x is 7.10. Column 8. x is 1.01. f of x is 7.14. Column 9. x is 1.1. f of x is 7.20." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 4em 4em 3em 4em 4em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.9999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.0001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>6.80</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.86</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.90</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.95</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7.05</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7.10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7.14</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7.20</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> cannot be definitively determined from the data in the table.

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> cannot be definitively determined from the data in the table.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
